div.l: For there before he stal bul curteysly
But now he was a theef outrageously
For whiche the wardeyn chydde and made fare
But therof set this Myller not a tare
He crakid bost and swore it was not so
Than were there yonge scolers two
That dweldyn in thys halle of whiche I sey
Testyf they were and lusty forto pley
And only for hyr myrthe and reuelrye
Vp on the wardeyn bysyly they crye
To yeue hym leue but a lytyl stounde
To go to the mylle ⁊ se her corn y grounde
And hardely they durste ley her necke
The myller shold not stele half a pecke
Of corn by sleyghte ne by force hem reue
And at the laste the wardeyn yaf hem leue
Iohn highte that one ⁊ aleyn highte þt other
Of a toun were they born that hyghte stroder
Fer in the north I can not telle where
Thys Aleyn maketh redy alle hys gere
And on an hors the sackes he cast anon
Forth goth aleyn the clerk ⁊ eke Iohn
With good swerd And bokeler by hys syde
Iohn knewe the wey hym nedyd no to gyde
And at the mylle the sak adoun he leyth
Aleyn spak first al hayl Symond in feyth
How faris thy fayre doughter and thy wyf
Aleyn welcome quod Symkyn by my lyf
And Iohn also how now what do ye here
Symond quod Iohn by god nede has no pere
Hym bus serue hym self that has no swayn
Or ellis he is a fool as clerkis sayn
Our mauncypyl I hope he wol be ded
Swa workis ay there wangis in his hed
And therfor I is come and thys aleyn
To grynde our corn and cary it home agayn
I pray you spede vs heyn in that ye may
It shal be do quod Symkyn by my fay
